Reviews.Title: Exceeded My Expectations -- By Miles
Reviews.Author: C.D.
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera or photography aficionado, so I cannot offer a super technical review -- of which the electronics section here on Amazon is replete with -- however what I can say, from a layman's perspective, is that this camera is unimaginably magnificent.I got this camera for my birthday and I simply wanted a camera that would provide a good, high-quality and affordable upgrade to my six megapixel Samsung camera that I bought three years ago - also for my birthday. Without even a modicum of hesitation, I can proudly say that this Panasonic camera more than exceeded my expectations.The 14 MP camera takes clear and crisp photographs and has a smorgasbord of different settings to make the pictures you take precisely how you want it. You can adjust your camera setting before you snap your picture, and you can also conveniently edit it after you take your picture. So you can never really take bad pictures. I find the settings to be really great.I also wanted a camera that would be good for action pictures. Often times, on my previous camera, I would take moving photographs and the pictures would come out blurry and you can tell that it was taken in motion. In contrast, this camera is wholly different. I tested out several moving pictures and the camera adroitly captures the moment I want captured beautifully, without any kind of visible motion blurriness.However, I leave the best aspect of this camera till last: the unthinkably great HD video capture. When buying a camera I wanted something that could capture HD videos so I can record different moments in film and store them, and perhaps something that would be good for YouTube videos: I found it. This video camera records gloriously crisp and colorful 720p HD. As good as the quality of the photo camera itself is, I think the video capture function is remarkably better. You simply just cannot fault it.I have never really been a Panasonic person. I know their stuff is purportedly of good quality and durable, but I have just never bought a product other than batteries. However, after buying this magnificent camera, I think I'll be investing in a lot more Panasonic products.I went in with pretty low expectations, and came out thoroughly impressed.Needless to say, I have been taking a whole lot of pictures on this thing.By the way, for the record, I haven't yet read the instruction manual, yet I have no problem operating the camera. I think that speaks wonders of its ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Make sure and use that wrist strap!
Reviews.Author: lraney87
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a decent camera. I'm no camera aficionado, I was just looking for something simple to carry around for impromptu pictures. I'd say everything about it is okay, but I'm writing this review more for pointing out flaws for future purchasers to consider (isn't that how most reviews go these days? :)). Here goes: Don't buy this camera if you're the kind of person who wants to zoom into the picture after you've taken it to make sure the pimple on your chin isn't visible. The touch screen navigation is super slow and not exactly sensitive. After you zoom on a picture, you have to tap the screen relentlessly for it to recognize your finger and actually move to the area of the picture you're wanting to zoom in on. Secondly, and I know I'm not the only person experiencing this because I've read other reviews on the internet while I was searching for a cost-effective solution, if you drop the camera, it's pretty much done for. I'd had this camera for just shy of a month when I dropped it on the ground and the sliding lens cover malfunctioned. It's really frustrating, because everything still works, it just doesn't recognize that the lens cover has been slid open. I can still look at pictures that have been taken, etc. I sent it back to Panasonic in hopes that A. they wouldn't notice the scratch on the corner, or B. that if they did notice, it was warranty-voiding. No dice. They wrote me back with a quote to repair it, and it's actually more expensive than buying a new camera. So, in conclusion, if you have an iron grip and aren't obsessed with reviewing your pictures until you upload them to your computer, this really is a good camera for the price. Good luck to all!

Reviews.Title: Super small and easy to carry around, with great pictures too
Reviews.Author: Thomas Osborne
Reviews.Content: I love this camera mostly because of its size, most other cameras of the same size don't take as nice pictures. Its super easy to carry around so you'll end up taking more pictures because you won't mind having it with you all the time. The Intelligent Auto works pretty well and it has face and scene detection which is great, along with really good image stabilization. Battery life on this thing is great too, You can take about 800-1000 pictures with this thing before you have to charge the battery.My only con is the low-light capability, its pretty poor. Outdoor or indoors with adequate lighting makes for some excellent pictures, but in low light the pictures come out pretty grainy. And the flash on this camera is rather weak so that doesn't help much either. You can raise the ISO up and it has a High Sensitivity scene mode as well to try to help make the picture come out, but only adds to the grain. Now this is expected in such a compact camera so I'm not docking because of it, but its definitely worth noting if you're looking to take a lot of low-light pictures.Overall this is a great buy, certainly not gonna take the same quality pics as its big brothers but if you want a simple, good quality compact then this is your camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product for an awesome price!!!
Reviews.Author: Ana Victoria Healey
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera for a really good price. I was quite pleased with the quality of the photos and the overall look.The touchscreen feature sometimes doesn't quite work as expected, but with patience it gets the job done.The 14.1 MP resolution results in great pictures, but the functions are still a little complicated for me... There are many different combinations that can be used which becomes a little too much.I highly recomend this camera. However, if you have issues with a touchscreen, this camera might not be the one for you, as the touchscreen on it sometimes doesn't respond.I am really pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: P. M. Mc Gonigle "Mountain Patti"
Reviews.Content: I have never had a camera so easy to use with a picture that looks incredible.  This camera is exactly as the ads on TV describe. . simple and I love the clarity in the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Overall good point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Edu Ch
Reviews.Content: i`m fairly happy with my purshase, the camera has a really nice small size that lets me carry it in my pocket without any nonesense (its smaller than my wallet). Takes good pictures and great HD video quality even when shooting small detail things like  necklaces for example. The inteligent mode does a great job recognizing the scene and its a very simple camera easy to work.The major failure I`ve come to notice is that in playback function upon zooming and scrolling the picture the touch panel does a lousy job and its function becomes rubish. Other than that the combination touch panel- real buttons do a great job.I would recomend this camera specially for the price, but advice to look around for better options if touch panel isnt your thing or u can manage with a camera bit larger and not so stylish.

Reviews.Title: Bad Battery Contact
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I put the new and fully-charged battery into my new camera and it did not work unless I pressed on the bottom part of the camera. It turns out that the battery is not in good contact with the camera!Amazon only provides refund not replacement for this item, meaning I will lose money by simply returning this item. Panasonic requires that I ship this item back to them and they will only be able to mail me back a refurbished one!So instead of going either way, I put a piece of paper behind the battery to force it to contact with the camera and now the camera is working...I do not recommend this item because of the quality of the camera and the return policy of both Amazon and Panasonic...

Reviews.Title: Great usability as a point-and-shoot; very good pictures; 4.5 stars
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "tech toy addict and chef"
Reviews.Content: I have both an FP3 and a Canon SD1400 as my always-with-me stable of cameras, and which is better depends a little bit on your shooting style and preferences as far as usability goes. Both take good pictures, but neither is in the same league as my Nikon DSLR, which is what I'd expect. I think a point-and-shoot camera should excel at just that -- letting you quickly capture a decent shot and be done with it. The Panasonic iA mode seems to do a very good job of selecting the right scene mode, especially indoors, vs. the Canon, but neither does a bad job.I have shot more video with the FP3 than the SD1400, and the former's video quality is truly amazing for what the camera is. Note that you cannot zoom at all while filming with the FP3, but with the SD1400, you can use *digital* zoom up to 4X, which gets recorded as such; this is not necessarily an advantage, since you are losing resolution in the process with digital zoom vs. optical (and you can do the same thing after the fact with a good video editor anyway).The Canon does seem to do a slightly better job with indoor flash. The Panasonic wins on the usability factor with the touchscreen, but not by much. It's a double-edged sword, with picture-taking selections being faster, but picture viewing being more clunky (e.g., you can't touch and hold a button to auto-repeat a navigation action, and zooming is limited).Comparing the zoom quality (both are 4X optical), one thing I like very much about the Panasonic vs. the Canon is the number of zoom stages.  You need to understand that power zooms on this kind of camera are not seamless.  The Canon has exactly 8 zoom steps from wide to telephoto; the Panasonic has 22.  This means you can do a better job of using the full frame (and all the meagapixels) with the Panasonic, rather than capturing more image than you really wanted.  I consider this a nice advantage.All that said, as much as I love the Canon's tiny size, it also makes the camera sort of fumbly to pull out of your pocket and shoot with; you have to pay attention to which way is up, etc. The Panasonic is certainly bigger, but still pocketable, but it's also easier to grab "blind" and get it open for shooting without fumbling around, since you can feel the difference between top and bottom, front and back. Lastly, the folded optics of the Panasonic (i.e., the sealed mechanism) means no dust and pocket lint gets in the mechanism to cause problems over the long term; this also makes it more truly pocketable, but if you always keep it in a case then it's a wash).Overall, for the price difference between the two, I would go with the FP3 unless you absolutely must have the smallest camera out there). I happened to get my SD1400 on sale around Christmas for essentially the same as the FP3, so that's how I wound up with both, thinking I would return one or the other. I wound up keeping them both for the different reasons above.As for build quality, while some people seem to think the FP3 (and FP1) feel cheaply built, I can tell you this: I had an FP1 at first, which got run over in its soft case by my (heavy) car.  I fully expected to find a bunch of plastic and metal shards in the case.  Instead, although the LCD did crack and craze a bit, the camera was mopstly intact *still works* in every other respect!  So I would call build quality excellent!

Reviews.Title: VERY POOR IMAGE QUALITY
Reviews.Author: Phil_D
Reviews.Content: I love Panny, but this camera is a weak effort.  The low light performance is abysmal and noisy, image quality is TERRIBLE even for a budget camera of this generation.By image quality, I mean contrast, sharpness, tone, flare, and color, all of which are very poor.  There is no distortion.Can I say anything good about it?  Well, I do like the menus, which are easy to navigate.  The flash is powerful and autofocus is fast and accurate (like all Panny's).  The size is just perfect - put it in your pocket and its invisible.  Surprisingly, the camera is very good for macro photography (maybe due to the ASPH lens?).  If you wanted a cheap book scanner for OCR, this would be ideal.  Pictures of my wedding ring were fairly sharp and contrasty, even full frame.  However, back away more than 3 feet and... well, I haven't seen such poor image quality in a compact since Kodak's from the mid 2000s.  I understand this is a budget camera, but they gave it the Lumix brand - why sell it at all with such disappointing performance?I think this exists just to make other Panny compacts look good.

Reviews.Title: Not so good
Reviews.Author: lumix
Reviews.Content: Cons: Image quality is not so good and the indoor IQ is a disaster... Low light and High ISO produces terrible noises. Even ISO 400 looks blur. In addition, the white balance is not accurate and don't trust what you see on the LCD screen.Pros: Nice design and perfect size. Lovely HD video recording function. Easy to use. Touch screen is acceptably responsive.This one doesn't match the reputation of Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Grate camera
Reviews.Author: Pildoring
Reviews.Content: Is a great camara, is beyong my xpectations, very good quality, the menu is very easy to use making you able to take fantastic pictures with the automatic focus. Is a great choice

Reviews.Title: Amazon did it again/1
Reviews.Author: Granny07480 "Pat Rinehart"
Reviews.Content: I don't know diddley squat about cameras - bought this one because of all it's great reviews.  My daughter called me on a Friday @ 5pm and said the grandson (who has Aspergers) dropped his camera (which he plays with everyday) and was hysterical.  I looked up cameras on Amazon, found this one and ordered it.  He received it ON SATURDAY MORNING!  HOLY CATS!  Hysteria resolved.  He e-mails me photos every week (I live in Maine - he is in NJ).  And he has even posted three movies on YouTube that he made with this camera  -  and for his age, they aren't bad.  I love you Amazon and Panasonic.  Good Job!

Reviews.Title: Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: gk
Reviews.Content: I adore this little point and shoot. It takes great photos and the touch screen IF you follow the instructions and stay in the zone where touches work does fine. It's nice a compact, great for a backup camera if you don't want to lug around a DSLR that day.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Good customer Service
Reviews.Author: N-
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera as a birthday gift and when we received it, the rear screen was cracked.  I notified PlatinumBuys and they immediately sent me free postage and easy instructions to send it back.  I had a new camera within 2 weeks and it has been well received.  Easy to use, clear, quick shutter speed and multiple setting options.  Good buy.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Tars Tarkas "Tars"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Panasonic DMC-FP3 for travel and general use. I wanted decent photos under varying conditions,  nothing professional or fussy, and easy to use and carry.I wrote a glowing review when I first got it. I've now used it for two years, and I don't like it. It doesn't take very crisp or vibrant photos, and I'm told it's probably the poor lens.  The touch screen commands and menus are cumbersome to navigate even when they make sense, which is seldom.  The review of photos is sticky (doesn't move to the next photo as it should), and there's no way to enlarge the photo you're viewing (not sure any cameras can, but this can't).  It's only virtues are: 1) very small, and 2) battery lasts a long time.Skip this one. I wish I'd spent maybe $50 more and gotten a good camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: I was forced into purchasing a new camera after my Samsung just completely died. I had the camera since '09 and I loved it very much.So, when buying a new camera, I did a lot of research.The camera was soo much smaller than my last one. I love it. It fits anywhere. I went around Universal the other day and had it in my back pocket.I wasn't so into the whole touch-screen thing. However, you really don't need to use it much except for looking through the pictures. The screen is different from an iphone and other touch-screen devices, so you're going to need to get use to it. I did it rather quickly.Some other reviewers complained about the speed the camera takes photos. It's probably like a 1.5 second delay. It's really not all that bad. My last camera was even worse because the flash had to charge up and it would take a good 15 seconds. So, this was definitely an upgrade for me.There's probably a million settings for everything. And it's super easy to figure them all out. I just leave my settings on auto though. I'm not trying to get pictures of plants, animals, kids in motion, fireworks, or any other thing they have settings for.Now, the first thing I did notice was the screen. Like, how it looked when you were viewing before snapping a picture. It looks kinda distorted. But as soon as you take a picture, you can see it's super clear.I was a little afraid of the possible picture quality since the lens was so little and didn't even come out. But none of that mattered.The pictures turn out amazing and I'm not even using the full 14mp. I think I'm actually at 3 mp because I don't have a lot of space on my sim card.Out in the sun, when not using flash, the pictures are super awesome. Super clear, wonderful colors. But, when you use flash in the dark-ish, the picture quality goes down a little.Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase. I'm definitely not returning it and I even purchased a 3 yr warranty.

Reviews.Title: This camera is too complex
Reviews.Author: Clee
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for a while before reviewing to make sure that my review was valid.  This camera captures good quality videos and pictures and has good audio also. Unfortunately there are way too many complex features to operate in retrieving pictures, storing or even selecting the appropriate screen to use. This makes it difficult to review pictures you just captured and sometimes a screen you do not wish to use may just appear.The battery life is short and the worst part is that the battery must be charged outside the camera.  This means that you must open the camera compartment frequently and you must always be handling the battery. I am certain that doing this will shorten the life of both camera and battery. If I had known that this was the method of charging the battery I would not have purchased the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great slim Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because its thin, durable, easy to use and  does a great Macro shot, my other cameras could not even come close and they cost much more. For me its a great little camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kristina Abbott
Reviews.Content: I have taken pictures as part of my work for years and have used every type of camera.  I wanted something compact so as to not have to lug around a big Canon Rebel T1i, struggling with swapping lenses and to be able to capture unexpected shots without any setup.  The Panasonic FP3 is the easiest, best, well-designed little powerhouse!Any inexpensive point-and-shoot will have its flaws.  I expected this to possibly have noticeable low-light issues and focus-finding problems.  Needless to say I was surprised again and again when it produced fantastic results in a variety of conditions, both indoors and outside (even in difficult direct sunlight with sharp contrast conditions).My FAVORITE feature is the touch focus.  Focus is my pet-peeve with cheap cameras (even some not-so-cheap ones).  They focus-hunt.  Low-end Canons are huge offenders of blurry images.  THIS camera is amazing in that you merely touch the part of the screen you want to focus on and snap your picture.  Excellent results every time!  After experiencing this touch focus feature, I will make this a top requirement in any future camera purchase.  It's awesome, especially if you do composed shots where you may want the foreground blurred and the background to be in focus or vice versa.  Total control over focus is incredible.I haven't experienced any issue with the touch screen.  It's very responsive and the images can be viewed quickly.  I think earlier reviewers who complained of poor screen response and slow picture review had the old firmware.  Mine came with version 1.2, which is the most current firmware release, and so the previous problems were remedied.This camera is now my favorite and will not leave my side.  For around $100 this is a helluva camera.

Reviews.Title: Product met expectations
Reviews.Author: Willaim J Comerford
Reviews.Content: The model was to replace a stolen camera,  I was pleased with its price and condition. Overall a good purchases.

Reviews.Title: Kind of tough on batteries
Reviews.Author: Michael Willey "Photog101"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife to keep in her purse.  I have had to replace the battery three times in almost two years.  It is just a fair camera for the inexperienced.

Reviews.Title: Fine
Reviews.Author: Hernany
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a decent camera. I'm no camera aficionado, I was just looking for something simple to carry around for impromptu pictures. I'd say everything about it is okay, but I'm writing this review more for pointing out flaws for future purchasers to consider (isn't that how most reviews go these days? :)). Here goes: Don't buy this camera if you're the kind of person who wants to zoom into the picture after you've taken it to make sure the pimple on your chin isn't visible. The touch screen navigation is super slow and not exactly sensitive. After you zoom on a picture, you have to tap the screen relentlessly for it to recognize your finger and actually move to the area of the picture you're wanting to zoom in on. Secondly, and I know I'm not the only person experiencing this because I've read other reviews on the internet while I was searching for a cost-effective solution, if you drop the camera, it's pretty much done for. I'd had this camera for just shy of a month when I dropped it on the ground and the sliding lens cover malfunctioned. It's really frustrating, because everything still works, it just doesn't recognize that the lens cover has been slid open. I can still look at pictures that have been taken, etc. I sent it back to Panasonic in hopes that A. they wouldn't notice the scratch on the corner, or B. that if they did notice, it was warranty-voiding. No dice. They wrote me back with a quote to repair it, and it's actually more expensive than buying a new camera. So, in conclusion, if you have an iron grip and aren't obsessed with reviewing your pictures until you upload them to your computer, this really is a good camera for the price. Good luck to all!

Reviews.Title: At a good price, a decent camera with nice features..ULTRA COMPACT !
Reviews.Author: M. Gehret "G-Man  Colorado"
Reviews.Content: This particular camera was re-designed by Panasonic which offers sleek, compact and 3 inch touch screen innovation. If buyer can get this camera at a good cost, its a great little camera and it provides fairly good pictures. It allows shooter to increase exisiting light to avoid washing out subject by using the flash mode. It also has a burst mode which will take a series of photos when that moment is too important to miss. The camera is fairly well built,  the lens cover in front will activate the camera or you can press and hold the small on/off button to activate power. Setting up the camera for the first time is important in chosing format of the LCD screen and photos taken. User may find that the LCD screen is "washed out" but this is due to various settings and can be corrected once you change settings accordingly.  Lastly, when half depressing the shutter button, this will focus and provide a better preview of what the shot will look like, (so that if it is necessary) you can make additional changes.  Not a bad compact point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Carlos E. Azuaje Arias "ceaa"
Reviews.Content: very gooditem is OKI likevery goodvery goodvery goodvery goodvery goodvery goodvery good

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a camera that I had owned in the past. In its compact size it is easy to use and takes wonderful pictures. It is a camera that I would recommend anyone to buy.

Reviews.Title: camara panasonic
Reviews.Author: Argenis G. Silvera S.
Reviews.Content: magnifica. realmente toma unas fotos muy buenas, informenme de ofertas relacionadas con camaras de video para el futuro, me qustaría saber

Reviews.Title: Lumix is user friendly, intuitive
Reviews.Author: E. Fields "Exokie"
Reviews.Content: Even without bothering to read the product manual, I was able to figure out how to get started using the Panasonic Lumix.  Small-size makes it ideal for casual travel photography.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: just mewritingareview
Reviews.Content: I studied a lot of reviews before purchasing this camera about 8 months ago.  I have a large SLR camera for fancier photography, but I wanted something small with video functions to carry in my pocket.  This camera is great for my use, which is mostly daylight and outside shots.  It takes good clear photos & videos, is easy to use and easy to carry with you.  I paid $104 for it and am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: excelente camara
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: muy buena camara. . . . . .  . . . . . .  .k jh kjh kjhk hk h

Reviews.Title: best camera thats not professional
Reviews.Author: sjames37
Reviews.Content: I Love this Camera. Well Actually my wife loves it. I feel it is about the best digital camera you can buy thats not professional grade.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: M. Missbach "Amateur Chef"
Reviews.Content: It's a good little camera, like the title says. I've had it for about 10 months now and haven't had any problems.One reviewer mentioned a problem about dropping it. Honestly I've dropped it like 18 times, including about 5 minutes ago, and it's been fine. There's a scratch on the front, but it in no way affects the functionality of the camera.Browsing pictures on the thing is annoying and slow, but if you're just checking one picture it's fine. I don't love the touchscreen, but it's a great camera for the price and takes excellent pictures.Intelligent auto is really nice, and there's also a zillion modes you can choose manually.For the price, I'd recommend it as a great little everyday camera.

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: Oyeols
Reviews.Content: This product is at best average. It takes good pictures, especially outdoors, but a few features it doesn't have makes it a little annoying.First of all, you can't zoom in or out when video recording!! This is pretty silly as even phones will do that.Also, the touch screen is rather poor.Slow and unresponsive. This makes it especially difficult when reviewing pictures on the device. If you press the back/forward button continuously, i'd expect it to pick up speed after a second or two,but alas it moves at the same speed. Imagine trying to go through 100 pictures!!

Reviews.Title: Una camara muy completa
Reviews.Author: Wilde
Reviews.Content: Desde que conoci las LUMIX, pienso que son las mejores del mercado.Es un camara muy completa, en este caso la elegi porque NO tiene el lente que se desplaza, esto es una gran ventaja para cuando hay que llevarla en los bolsillos.La falla mas comun de las camara es la lente que se traba, esta es una fortaleza de la LUMIX DMC-FP3 porque al no tener esa parte movil es mucho mas durable.El estabilizador de imagen es exelente, saca muy buenas fotos, tiene muchas funciones, el zoom es muy aceptable.La unico que no me parece exelente es el screen touch, se ensucia mucho el visor y no es tan practico.Exelente camara digital.Sorry, but i write very bad english.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Luis F. Ocampo "book"
Reviews.Content: Very good, small good quality pictures 14 MP easy to operate, nice looking. Arrived in time.Nice color just what I was looking for

Reviews.Title: Quite wonderful
Reviews.Author: Bay Girl "Mwauky"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  I bought it for a newby digital camera user, and he loves it.  It has all the features he wanted!  Thank you for making such a wonderful product available for such a magnificent price.PS  I liked it so much, I got another one.

Reviews.Title: small but mighty
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera realy surprised me. It is great to take along because it fits in my shirt pocket.It does what I want and then some.

Reviews.Title: Big Hit
Reviews.Author: J. ROGERS
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon SLR.  I love the camera, but it is bulky.  My wife loves the Nikon, but she was looking for something compact.  I bought this camera because of other reviews, and quite honestly, the price.  The camera takes excellent pictures and is extremely easy to use.  Downloading to the computer is also very simple.  It is a perfect size and has a great screen.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A super camera with super results.
Reviews.Author: Bazza
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this camera. It fits in the pocket and takes fabulous photos and videos. I've had many people ask me about the camera as they've seen the results. For the price, it's a great buy!!!!

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for-
Reviews.Author: daveoso
Reviews.Content: I have a nice SLR type  camera and like it alot but it is large and bulky. i wanted a small easy to use camera that takes great pictures. With so many to choose from I did alot of searching and comparing. Well, I made a good decision with this camera, It's just what I wanted and does everything I want it to in a small, lightweight camera. I would recomend it to anyone that wants a small, easy to use camera that takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for its price range!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace the FP1 that my mom lost while on vacation. I bought this one because it was basically the same thing as the FP1 except with a bigger sensor and a touch screen for only a few dollars more.This model is totally worth the few extra bucks over the FP1, using the touch screen you can select where you want the camera to focus and the interface is sssooooo much easier to use. All in all its a great camera and I dont know any other camera for under $150 that has all these features.I bought another one for my uncle as a gift and he loves it!! The HD video is pretty good too. I may buy one for my self just to take on short trips instead of my DSLR. I recommend  this camera to any one lookin for a camera under $120.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Isaac Montoya "(: ǝʞI"
Reviews.Content: Has a quick start up takes great pictures as seen with some of my uploads and takes great video.Couldnt really ask any more from the price.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Barnes
Reviews.Content: I loooooove this camera! I was looking for a small, quick camera that takes good quality photos when I bought this. I used to have a Nikon Coolpix, but it was klunky and slow. I couldn't fit it in my purse very well and by the time it started up I had missed the picture I wanted to take. The Lumix is totally different, though! I could quickly pull it out of my purse, pull the lens cover down (no messing with on/off buttons) and BAM! picture was taken! It is super fast, amazing quality (better night pictures than my old coolpix), and I love the touchscreen. My only complaint is that the touch screen doesn't zoom in like you think it would (like an Iphone). The zoom on reviewing pictures is the same zoom that you use when taking pictures (the dial where the shutter release is.)

Reviews.Title: Very pleased so far
Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: I work with a wildlife center that specializes in the North American Bobcat. I needed an extremely adaptable camera that takes exceptional pictures at high speeds, and that, due to the nature of it's primary use, not overly expensive, and durable.I like that this camera does not have a retractable lens. The reason for this is that in the bobcat enclosures, we use pine shavings for our bedding. Retractable lenses leave more space for dirt and debris to get into the camera. The sliding lens cover is very useful, and easier to keep clean.The picture quality exceeded my expectations, and the settings for this point and shoot camera make it a very useful tool in photographing my subjects. The screen is a good size, though the camera was a little thicker than I wanted it to be. The few buttons down the side are easy to use, as is the touch screen.Great camera, great price.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: J.W.H.
Reviews.Content: Just got this Friday. 3 days ago. So far I am impressed. I took some pics going down the road while my friend drove. Very clear. Easy to use, good quality pics and seems like battery life is good so far. The fast burst option is great. Very fast. Also the response time of each pic. is very fast. Videos are clear with pretty good sound. Would definately recommend the class 6 or better memory card as was recommended to me theough reviews. Solid little camera and good price. Hope it lasts.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: A. stevens "ElMo Is DeAd"
Reviews.Content: It is the best camera i have ever had!its amazing!and a great price...picture quaility is so good..the only CON is with the video when you upload it it is HD so it takes a long time to upload 2 min. videos...but other than that..Its great.

Reviews.Title: Great Video - Worst Still Pics Imginable!
Reviews.Author: Ed Osworth "The Joy Professor"
Reviews.Content: WOW - after reading all the great reviews I bought this and was totally disappointed. I passed on the Nikon FinePix becuase it didn't have an HD Video mode which this does.  Took dozens of test stills and videos and was amazed at the beautiful clear HD videos it takes.And flaberghasted at how consistently BAD the still photos are - no matter the settings. Im low light a horrible yellow tint saturates everything - even in medium light the pics all look dark. And focus is all over the chart - about 1 out of 3 photos came out in focus. most are totally out of focus - even in daylight...In my opinion - and this is my 10th digital camera - FAIL

Reviews.Title: Pictures are not as sharp or vivid? (even in Vivid mode)
Reviews.Author: Mia Alentajan "Mian"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP3 last June 2010. I have had 2 Sony cybershots in the past, though pictures were nice and sharp, the lifespan of these previous cameras were only 2 years max.  For the Lumix, my photos are not very sharp -- a bit hazy -- despite cleaning the lens, and putting it in Vivid mode.  Pls help... I know Panasonic Lumix has a good reputation as a good camera, but I'm not seeing this in my Lumix now.... pls help.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP3 broke within first 2 months of purchase
Reviews.Author: Eddie U
Reviews.Content: I did research this brand and model before final purchase.  I used it for about 2 months and camera started to act out and finally stopped working all together.  If I did not have warranty, I would have lost $190!  However, Panasonic shipped me two different models which did not meet my expectations.  I returned the first one, but decided to keep second one (I did not want to continue arguing with Panasonic on their product low quality. However, to be fair, the last camera is still working and takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Simple, Swift, Sleek Stuff
Reviews.Author: Anil Bakshi "Anil"
Reviews.Content: Needed a pocket able camera, to take quick pics when driving (!!!). Never miss a funny bumper sticker & much more.1. Colors : True, good options of natural, b/w, warm, sepia, vivid, cool. Prefer Warm or Vivid in Normal pic mode.2. Modes : Normal, Scene Mode (25 options), Motion. & iA intelligent auto. In iA mode, the icon changes logically to portrait, macro, scenery : so it works, you can see the auto changes in aperture & shutter time.3. Touch Screen: Was angry since was using the nail tips as pin pricks. DID NOT WORK. As I used the finger pods, the touch screen is swift, fast enough, doe not bore/wait. Sub menus must be dug in to understand the full features of this slim camera. Some of the sunset pictures from behind the windscreen were very good.4. Wrist Wrap. Whether a 100 $ P&S; or high end, never hold a camera without the wrist wrap.Lumix, Panasonic, Lieca : make a respectable possession. Since camera has a slider on/off, don't know yet the purpose of the On/Off switch. Rec this camera. (also own three more Lumix, so a biased guy !!).

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Lili_08
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good to start with. It's affordable price, nice sleek design, touch screen and other simple options you can use. The problem is you cannot set the date attach to the photo picture as I had in my old Nikon camera. Overall, this camera is quite good. The video is great. Simple camera but tells alot.

Reviews.Title: lo maximo
Reviews.Author: lo maximo
Reviews.Content: this camera is the best and highly recommend amazon comptrado the staff totally serious when products despachardthis camera is the best and highly recommend amazon comptrado the staff totally serious when products despachard

Reviews.Title: do i? :)
Reviews.Author: do i?
Reviews.Content: i ordered this camera because it has good specifications for that "much" money,but,do i get a charger for battery?or i would have to buy it separetly?

ProductInfo.Features:
The flat body & compact size of the DMC-FP3 allow it to fit nicely into a small handbag
The new lens cover both protects the lens form scratches or dusts & serves as the cam's power swth
The static sensor type 3.0-inch touch-screen LCD gives you an intuitive control thanks to a hybrid operation combined with the 4 operation buttons
Touch operation is free and smooth either in recording or playing back images
The DMC-FP3 is equipped with a 4x optical zoom lens 35mm cam eqvi: 35-140mm
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP3 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch Touch-Screen LCD (Black)
